Activity: Log in to the system, check emails for urgent requests or updates. Prioritize emails from @clinlead-1 and @his-1 related to the EHR collection project.
Review the week's goals: medical record identification, data abstraction form development, and training preparation. Create a detailed personal task list for each goal.

Begin identifying the location of historical medical records. Focus on electronic records first. Contact @his-1 via email to inquire about the structure of the EHR system and any known repositories for influenza-related data. @his-1 Subject: Inquiry Regarding EHR Data Repositories for Influenza Information
Research data retention policies for both electronic and paper records at the institution. Document the policies and note any implications for the project.
Start compiling a list of potential storage locations for paper records containing influenza-related information. Include specific departments or archives.
Lunch break. Review relevant articles on medical record management best practices.
Draft an email to @mrs-2 and @mrs-1 to request their input on locating specific paper record storage areas. @mrs-2 @mrs-1 Subject: Request for Input on Locating Influenza-Related Paper Records
Begin drafting a preliminary data abstraction form. Focus on patient demographics (name, DOB, MRN, address). Refer to existing data abstraction forms for guidance.
Research and list the specific EHR data elements required for the abstraction form (vaccination status, diagnosis codes (ICD-10), symptoms, lab results, prescriptions, hospitalizations).
Continue populating the preliminary data abstraction form with identified EHR data elements.
Review task list and ensure all items have been addressed. Prepare for tomorrow.
